column4: is there someone that can assist with a Broadcom 4309 on Ubuntu 7.04?
did you do apt-get install bcm43xx-fwcutter ?
I did.....tried using the ndiswrapper to get the driver installed....still stuck
looks like device and driver are present
eth0:wired, eth1:internal wireless, eth2:usb wireless (usb wireless the only way to connect to the internet currently)
so your internal wireless is tg3/
eth1 does not show up under administration->network devices, and I cannot make any wireless connections if eth2 is not connected
can you associate with an access point with eth1? ie: iwconfig eth1 essid belkin && iwconfig eth1 rate 11M
then please repaste: iwconfig and ifconfig in the same patsebin
